revised_title: Nuclear Absorption and Extra-Absorption of Heavy Elements in Hard X-Rays
tldr: The authors conducted absorption measurements of hard X-rays from a homogeneous source to study the extra-absorption in heavy elements. They discovered the existence of nuclear absorption and a new scattered radiation, which suggests that the nucleus might be left in an excited state or undergo disintegration after interaction. The investigation of excitation or disintegration potentials requires a continuous range of wavelengths, which can be secured by using a pressure ionization chamber and a sensitive Hoffmann electrometer for measurements.
